instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 a1466 no power
threads.message:
hello, this no sign of corrosion got green orange light fan spin like 1sec 
after i removed the battery fan spins but no display no usb activity, 
i tried smc bypass fan spins high but no display (no capslock light also)
tried good clean me nothing changes

tried the whole board to other known working case inluding screen still same
ppbus_g3h 8.6v 
3v3_S5/SUS3.3v
smc_onoff 3.4V

threads.title: 820-00165 a1466 no power
threads.message:
Still doesn't start with known good battery connected?
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of U7100.

PLT_RESET_L goes high?

threads.title: 820-00165 a1466 no power
threads.message:
with good battery still same
17/18  3.9ohms
27/28 20.5ohms

PLT_RESET_L 3.3v

threads.title: 820-00165 a1466 no power
threads.message:
Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and traces.

You can try CPU heat test.

threads.title: 820-00165 a1466 no power
threads.message:
SPI  resistor and traces looks okay 

cpu heat test what do u mean by this?
heat cpu with quality flux?

btw cpu is getting hot

threads.title: 820-00165 a1466 no power
threads.message:
1800-200 degress, no more than 15-20s.
Don't need to melt the balls; just burn eventually accumulated crap underneath.

You can also try to reball SMC.
